intro: Chiococca micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered chiococca, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Chiococca micrantha is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests.
